params._owner: The address which owns the funds.
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.

returns._addressNonces: The number of successful permits by the specified address.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._deadline: The deadline timestamp, type(uint256).max for max deadline

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._balance: The gon balance of the specified address.

params._monetaryPolicy: The address of the monetary policy contract to use for authentication.

params._from: The address you want to send tokens from.
params._to: The address you want to transfer to.

params._from: The address you want to send tokens from.
params._to: The address you want to transfer to.
params._value: The amount of tokens to be transferred.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

allowance(address,address).notice: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner has allowed to a spender.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. This method is included for ERC20 compatibility. increaseAllowance and decreaseAllowance should be used instead. Changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may transfer both the old and the new allowance - if they are both greater than zero - if a transfer transaction is mined before the later approve() call is mined.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner has allowed to a spender.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner has allowed to a spender. This method should be used instead of approve() to avoid the double approval vulnerability described above.

nonces(address).notice: Returns the nonces of a given address

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Allows for approvals to be made via secp256k1 signatures.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfer tokens to a specified address.

transferAll(address).notice: Transfer all of the sender's wallet balance to a specified address.

transferAllFrom(address,address).notice: Transfer all balance tokens from one address to another.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer tokens from one address to another.

@notice Returns the scaled total supply

@title uFragments ERC20 token
 @notice USDA uses the uFragments concept from the Ideal Money project to play interest
      Implementation is shamelessly borrowed from Ampleforth project
      uFragments is a normal ERC20 token, but its supply can be adjusted by splitting and
      combining tokens proportionally across all wallets.
      uFragment balances are internally represented with a hidden denomination, 'gons'.
      We support splitting the currency in expansion and combining the currency on contraction by
      changing the exchange rate between the hidden 'gons' and the public 'fragments'.
